content:
MyHeritage allows you to import your family tree from other platforms, including Ancestry.com, making it easy to get started. Here's how:

1. **GEDCOM import**: MyHeritage supports GEDCOM files, a standard format for exchanging genealogy data. You can export your family tree from Ancestry.com or other platforms as a GEDCOM file and then import it into MyHeritage.
2. **Direct import from Ancestry.com**: MyHeritage has a direct import feature that allows you to import your Ancestry.com family tree directly into MyHeritage. This requires you to sign in to your Ancestry.com account and authorize the import.
3. **FamilySearch import**: MyHeritage also allows you to import your family tree from FamilySearch.org, if you have a tree built there.

To import your family tree into MyHeritage:

1. Sign in to your MyHeritage account or create a new one.
2. Click on the "Family Tree" tab and then "Import Family Tree" (or "Upload a GEDCOM file" if you have a GEDCOM file).
3. Choose the source of your import: Ancestry.com, FamilySearch, or GEDCOM file.
4. Follow the prompts to authorize the import, select the tree you want to import, and choose the import options.

MyHeritage will then import your family tree, including individuals, relationships, and some media files (like photos). Note that some data, like DNA results or subscription-only content, might not be imported.

After importing your tree, you can review and edit the data to ensure everything is accurate and organized. MyHeritage also offers tools to help you clean up and merge duplicate records, if needed.

Starting with an existing family tree will save you a significant amount of time and effort. You can then focus on adding more information, including those precious family recipes!

Remember, MyHeritage offers a free trial, so you can test their features and import your family tree before committing to a subscription.
